intro: Seemannaralia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in grassland and savanna habitats. The plants typically have hairy stems and basal leaves, with bright yellow flowers arranged in composite heads. Seemannaralia species are known for their medicinal properties and are sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies. They play an important role in their native ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and animals.
